title: Matt Fitzpatrick bids to become first Englishman to win six European Tour titles before 26th birthday at Italian Open
text:
Matt Fitzpatrick will on Sunday attempt to go where even illustrious countrymen such as Sir Nick Faldo, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose failed, by becoming the first Englishman to win six European Tour titles before his 26th birthday.

Certainly the manner in which the Yorkshireman overcame a third-round wobble suggests that this history job at the Italian Open will not be beyond him. Having started with a one-shot advantage in Rome, Fitzpatrick, 25, found himself three behind by the 10th and at a loss to explain what was going wrong.

“I was one-over for the day but didn’t think I was swinging it badly at all,” Fitzpatrick said. “I mentioned as much to Billy [Foster, his caddie] and he told me just to stay patient. That put me back on track and to finish the way I did was great.”

Indeed, the four birdies in the last six holes for a 68 and a 15-under total were significant but so, too were the par saves at the 11th and 12th. Fitzpatrick has been around for so long that sometimes it is easy to forget how relatively young he is, but there has been a definite maturing in the past months.
description: Matt Fitzpatrick will on Sunday attempt to go where even illustrious countrymen such as Sir Nick Faldo, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose failed, by becoming the first Englishman to win six European Tour titles before his 26th birthday.
